The most sensitive test for C. difficile infection is stool culture for bacterial isolation and toxin presence, as it can detect the presence of the bacteria and its toxins in the stool. Endoscopy can show colitis, but may not always detect the bacteria. A Gram stain of stool sample and nucleic acid amplification test can also be used to diagnose C. difficile infection, but they may not always be as sensitive as stool culture.
